subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]The Future of Emerging Markets: Capturing A Rising Digital Generation[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]The developing world is coming online at a dizzying pace. Every second, three people go online for the first time, leapfrogging two decades of Western digitization, becoming consumers from their new, cheap smartphones. Defined by McKinsey & Co. as "the biggest growth opportunity in the history of capitalism," Kevin Carter gives you an on-the-ground look at the next wave of global internet giants, driven by the 5.4 billion people under age 30 in emerging and frontier markets.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Explain%20how%20McKinsey's%20%5C%22biggest%20growth%20opportunity%20in%20the%20history%20of%20capitalism%5C%22%20is%20now%20on%20discount%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22How%20investors%20can%20capitalize%20on%20the%20%5C%22next%205%20billion%5C%22%20connected%20consumers%20across%20the%20developing%20world%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22How%20the%20world's%20largest%20Gen-Z%20population%20will%20shape%20the%20future%20of%20the%20world's%20largest%20democracy%3A%20India's%20coming%20golden%20age%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Kevin Carter is the founder of the Emerging Markets Internet and Ecommerce ETF (EMQQ) and chairman of the EMQQ Index Committee. He was also the founder and CEO of AlphaShares, a firm offering emerging market exchange-traded funds (ETFs) in partnership with Guggenheim Investments. Carter received his economics degree from the University of Arizona and started his investing career in 1992.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row [/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" buttom_link_src="url:https%3A%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2F2FLR-q_2Ces||target:%20_blank|" tutorials=""][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_button button_text="Presenter's Slides" main_style="style-2" box_shadow="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)" buttom_link_src="url:https%3A%2F%2Faaiila.org%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2022%2F05%2FMark-Skousen-Wisdom-Madness-of-Crowds_2022-05-28.pdf||target:%20_blank|" tutorials=""][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1528420045018{padding-right: 5% !important;padding-left: 5% !important;}" col_shadow="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)" col_shadow_hover="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]Madness or Wisdom of Crowds? Puzzles & Paradoxes of Wall St.[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]In this provocative session, Dr. Mark Skousen auctions off a jar of pennies to demonstrate both the wisdom of crowds and the madness of crowds. He also analyzes a number of fascinating financial anomalies, including the negative interest rate dilemma, the random walk hypothesis, the big oil vs. big blue paradox, the weekend effect, the gold puzzler, and other strange effects on Wall Street. This is a "Combo Event (Skirball "in person" plus Webinar), however for all those attending in person they will receive a Free autographed copy of the 10th anniversary addition of "The Maxims of Wall Street." Additional copies will be available for $10.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Lessons%20from%20auctioning%20off%20a%20jar%20of%20pennies%3A%20How%20to%20avoid%20action%20fever%20when%20you%20buy%20hot%20stocks%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Why%20the%20stock%20market%20reflects%20both%20the%20wisdom%20of%20crowds%20and%20the%20madness%20of%20crowds%2C%20and%20how%20to%20know%20the%20difference%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Solving%20the%20dividend%20paradox%20and%20other%20anomalies%20on%20Wall%20Street%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Mark Skousen, Ph.D., is editor in chief of Forecasts & Strategies, an award-winning investment newsletter (www.markskousen.com). He was recently named one of the top 20 living economists in the world, and in 2018, Steve Forbes awarded him a Triple Crown in Economics for his work in economic theory, history and education. In 2014, he was appointed a presidential fellow at Chapman University. He has worked for the government (as a CIA analyst), nonprofits (president of FEE) and several for-profit companies. In 2004–05, he taught economics and finance at Columbia Business School and Columbia University. He was a columnist for Forbes magazine. His investment books include “Investing in One Lesson” (Regnery Publishing, 2007), “The Maxims of Wall Street” (Capital Press, 2017) and “A Viennese Waltz Down Wall Street: Austrian Economics for Investors” (LFB Publishers, 2013).[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_separator color="blue"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/6"][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="2/3"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]

SKIRBALL/WEBINAR ACCESS INFORMATION

 PREPAY FOR THIS MAY 21 SKIRBALL OR WEBINAR MEETING ONLY
You may prepay $15 for this Skirball meeting or pay $18 at the door, or pay $15 for the Webinar.
THIS PURCHASE SITE WILL CLOSE ON FRIDAY, MAY 20 AT 6 PM.
 
Note: (1) A Webinar registration link for this event will be emailed to payees on two dates: May 13 in the early evening, and May 20 after this purchase site closes at 6 pm; (2) Annual pass holders will receive a "name tag pass" at the Skirball Cultural Center at each of the 5 Skirball meetings next year, and will also receive an email with the registration link for all 10 Webinar meetings.  You will have the choice of viewing the Webinar on screen or attending the Skirball Center in person. Your annual pass gives you access to Skirball or the Webinar for each of the five combo Skirball/Webinar events.
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1639077484345{background-color: #b5ffb6 !important;}"][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/6"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Financial Education meeting information that focuses on the broad overview of basic individual investing in today's market.
